content: Who was the first to fly across the Atlantic Ocean?

The first person to fly across the Atlantic Ocean was John Alcock, along with his navigator Arthur Whitten Brown. They completed the historic flight in June 1919, flying non-stop from St. John's, Newfoundland, Canada, to Clifden, Ireland, in a Vickers Vimy bomber. For their achievement, they were knighted by King George V and awarded a £10,000 prize from the Daily Mail newspaper.
